div.p: MUSCLES AND SINEWS of a ANIMAL OR HUMAN.
1. The general term for animal flesh or or any flesh viewed as possible food is ròu 肉. See MEAT.
2. Jī 肌 refers to living human flesh and muscle, but the word has extended uses like "flesh" in "the flesh of an orange".
BODY 27. 肉，秦漢後用於人，泛指人肉。
肌，附著在人體骨頭上的肉。
腴，人或動物腹下的肥肉。
胂，腰 [ 月＋氐 ] 骨兩旁的肌肉。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: caro is the general word for flesh as opposed to other body tissue like sinews etc.
pulpa refers to flesh insofar as it is edible or even a delicacy, as opposed to bones etc.
viscera refers to any tissue between skin and bones.

bibl.title: Bibliographisches Handbuch zur Sprachinhaltsforschung. Teil II. Systematischer Teil. B. Ordnung nach Sinnbezirken (mit einem alphabetischen Begriffsschluessel): Der Mensch und seine Welt im Spiegel der Sprachforschung
中國文化背景八千詞 Zhongguo wenhua beijing ba qian ci

Handbook of Greek Synonymes, from the French of M. Alex. Pillon, Librarian of the Bibliothèque Royale , at Paris, and one of the editors of the new edition of Plaché's Dictionnaire Grec-Français, edited, with notes, by the Rev. Thomas Kerchever Arnold, M.A. Rector of Lyndon, and late fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge
